result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

1:50 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Jason E Stone in court, in custody.  Attorney Ari S Becker in court for Jason E Stone.  Attorney Rebekah Renneke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Defendant Jason E Stone in court, in custody.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Colloquy w/ Defn; RE: efforts made in obtaining a lawyer. SPD confirmed via email Defn declined representation. Defn wishes to apply for SPD. SPD notified f/w. Colloquy w/ defn RE: time limits for a preliminary hearing. CT accepts waiver. CT sets over prelim for defn to apply for SPD. Bail cont.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Jason E Stone in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. DE to apply with SPD. Court finds good cause to set another hearing.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amandeep B
- Defendant shall not be at any gas stations.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

1:43 PM Defendant Jason E Stone in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Jason E Stone.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
